entry.title: Combined summary - Bitcoin Core 0.16.2 released
entry.summary: Bitcoin Core, a digital currency software, has released version 0.16.2 with various bugfixes and updated translations. The new version is available for download from bitcoincore.org or through bittorrent. Users are encouraged to report bugs using the issue tracker at GitHub. It is recommended that users upgrade to the new version, and instructions on how to upgrade are given in the release notes. The release notes also include a warning that wallets created in 0.16 and later are not compatible with versions prior to 0.16. Existing wallets that were created with older versions are not affected by this. Compatibility information is also included, stating that Bitcoin Core is extensively tested on multiple operating systems using the Linux kernel, macOS 10.8+, and Windows Vista and later. However, Windows XP is not supported, and it should also work on most other Unix-like systems but is not frequently tested on them.The change log for version 0.16.2 includes fixes for wallet issues, RPC and other APIs, GUI, build system, and tests and QA. Credits are given to everyone who directly contributed to this release, as well as those who reported security issues and helped with translations. Additionally, a PGP signature is provided for download.
